title: The Tommyknockers
author: Stephen King

quote_last: and still no one had shown up, Gardener began to wonder if maybe they were quitting. He toyed with the idea as he sat in Bobbi’s rocker on the porch, fingering the big, puffy bruise on the side of his face where Bozeman had clouted him.
title: The Tommyknockers

quote_first: He paid the waitress and left the café. It was
quote_last: . The sun pressed against the inside of a thin layer of cloud. He unbuttoned his jacket as he hurried down Queensway. His mind, unleashed, sprang forwards.
title: Dreams of Leaving
